borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><p>The proposed off street parking provision by reason of its location at a road bend is not considered to be safe and usable. In addition, th<span style="font-size: 11pt;">e provision of off street parking would prevent use of the on street CPZ which is not supported and a dropped kerb could not be granted. As such, the proposal is contrary to:</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">T6 Car Parking and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">T6.1 Residential Car Parking of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">London Plan (March 2021)</span></p><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy BR9 Parking and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy BR10 Sustainable Transport of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMT3 Car Parking of </span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021</span><br></p>

<p class="MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst" style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); text-align: justify; text-indent: -18pt; line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">The proposed new dwelling by reason of its siting would reduce the spaciousness between the host dwelling and the East boundary. &nbsp;This would unbalance the symmetry and uniformity of the terraces given their rhythm and regular form. The spaciousness between the property and the entrance to the banjo cul-de-sac is a characteristic heritage feature of the Becontree Estate. The proposal would result in an adverse impact on the open character of this streetscene, and appear overly intrusive by reducing this gap and disrupting the build line between the existing terrace and the terrace on the banjo cul-de-sac. Properties positioned at the entrance of a banjo cul-de-sac have been dismissed at appeal for similar reasoning, for example;&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">APP/Z5060/D/21/3278270</span><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle" style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); text-align: justify; line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">&nbsp;</span></p><p class="MsoListParagraphCxSpLast" style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); text-align: justify; line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">As such the proposal is contrary to:&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"></p><ul type="disc" style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><li class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">National Planning Policy Framework (2021):</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">Policies D1, D4, D8, of The London Plan (March 2021);</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">Policy CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></li><li class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</span></li></ul>

<p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed new dwelling would fail to meet the required space standards for a property of its size. As such it is not considered that the proposed new dwelling will meet the needs of future residents and ensure a satisfactory lifestyle is provided.&nbsp; The proposal is contrary to:</span></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policy D6 (</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Housing quality and standards) o</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">f the London Plan (2021);</span></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">- Policy BP6 (Internal space standards) of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">- DCLG Technical Housing Standards (nationally described space standard) (DCLG, March 2015) (as amended)&nbsp;</span></p>
description: Construction of a two storey three bedroom dwellinghouse at the land adjacent to 68 Barnmead Road.

constraints_details.result: 68 Barnmead Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 5DX
